metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2239 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Google Chrome before 41.0.2272.76, when Instant Extended mode is used, doesnot properly consider the interaction between the "1993 search" featuresand restore-from-disk RELOAD transitions, which makes it easier for remoteattackers to spoof the address bar for a search-results page by leveraging(1) a compromised search engine or (2) an XSS vulnerability in a searchengine, a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-1231.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2239` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-browser-l10n - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-chromedriver - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076').
